fields.description:
Place "Recent Boards" and "Recent Projects" to the start page
The old UI had this option. Customer has informed that needs to navigate right now in order search these options.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Allow issue-creation in a new windows/tab in the new UI. "Create new issue " was before (old UI) able to open in a new window. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a "right-click > open in a new tab" and a "Command + Click (MAC)" and a "Ctrl + Click (PC)" as an option for creating issue dialogue in a dedicated tab rather than popup dialogue
 
h3. Workaround
You can access the create issue dialogue by manually entering https://<basr_url>.atlassian.net/secure/CreateIssue!default.jspa 
TIP: Save the URL in your bookmarks for quick access

h3. NOTE on the workaround:
There is a limitation to this workaround where the "Paste image from clipboard" option (Command+V MAC or Ctrl+V PC) will not work from this screen you will need to drag and drop an image into the screen to add an image to the description field, noting this will only work if the attachment field is also added to the create issue screen.
fields.summary: Allow issue-creation in a new windows/tab in the new UI

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Inconsistent behavior.  Email notifications that are sent when a user edit's a worklog are showing up as an stack trace and not the notification.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit an issue's worklog
# View notification sent via email

h3. Expected Results

Notification shows up such as:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
Worklog entry:	12 minutes logged by Josh loe
Change By:	Josh loe
Remaining Estimate:	2 weeks 1 week, 4 days, 7 hours, 48 minutes
Time Spent:	12 minutes
{code}

h3. Actual Results
Email notification does not show the actions, instead a stack trace:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
An error occurred whilst rendering this message. Please contact the administrators, and inform them of this bug. Details: ------- org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'diff' in class com.atlassian.jira.mail.DiffUtils threw exception java.lang.NullPointerException at templates/email/html/includes/patterns/worklog-top.vm[line 9, column 46] at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTMethod.handleInvocationException(ASTMethod.java:337) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTMethod.execute(ASTMethod.java:284) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTReference.execute(ASTReference.java:262) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTReference.value(ASTReference.java:507) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTExpression.value(ASTExpression.java:71) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTSetDirective.render(ASTSetDirective.java:142) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTBlock.render(ASTBlock.java:72) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTElseIfStatement.render(ASTElseIfStatement.java:92) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTIfStatement.render(ASTIfStatement.java:106) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTBlock.render(ASTBlock.java:72) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTIfStatement.render(ASTIfStatement.java:87) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTBlock.render(ASTBlock.java:72) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTIfStatement.render(ASTIfStatement.java:87) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.SimpleNode.render(SimpleNode.java:336) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.directive.Parse.render(Parse.java:263) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTDirective.render(ASTDirective.java:175) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTBlock.render(ASTBlock.java:72) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTIfStatement.render(ASTIfStatement.java:87) at
{code}

h3. Notes
This is inconsistent behavior, and is not occuring on every worklog modification.

h3.Workaround

There is no work around at this time/
fields.summary: Notifications when a work log is editted are showing a stack trace instead of the notification.

fields.description:
The new UI layout for issue display wastes a lot of space on empty margins, which could be used for the display of the data.

see screen shot (below):
 !image-2018-03-15-11-55-32-224.png!

Even when the screen has been maximized the ticket detail continues to confine itself to an artificial margin area.

This has been so troubling that one of our developers wrote a chrome extension to try and force one of our custom fields - "acceptance criteria" to take up the entire space. 

Obviously this is a band-aid and is prone to breaking.  This is a problem that needs to be fixed within the product code itself.
fields.summary: New Jira UI wastes information display space with empty margins

fields.description:
In the new Jira UI Experience it has become rather cumbersome to get to where you can enter a JQL search. I have attempted to use the Magnifying Glass search which would be ideal as it is so convenient however it produces odd results.

When I enter something like this - _project = ftr and issuetype=task and status != done_
I'm directed to the advanced search screen w/ a result of - _project = FTR AND status = Done AND text ~ "project =  and issuetype=task and status !="_

so I then have to correct the search from there.
fields.summary: As a user I would like the ability to enter an advanced JQL directly in the search bar

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Filters cannot be edited or have their owner changed if it is shared with a project which cannot be accessed

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create 2 projects on a Jira cloud site
# Add issues to these projects
# Create a complex filter to return issues from both projects 
# Save the filter and share it with both projects
# Revoke the "Browse project" permission from one of the projects
# Try to edit the filter or try to change the filter's owner

h3. Expected Results
The user can edit the filter and can change the filter's owner

h3. Actual Results
The user cannot edit the filter or change its owner. The messages below are displayed:

* When the user tries to edit the filter:

{quote}
The filter *Filter* could not be saved.
{quote}

 !Screen Shot 2018-03-14 at 3.30.46 PM.png|thumbnail! 

* When the user tries to change the filter owner:

{quote}
The user 'User' does not have permission to share with Project: 'Project'
{quote}

 !Screen Shot 2018-03-14 at 3.31.05 PM.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Notes


h3.Workaround

Remove the project the user does not have permission from the share filter option. To do it, please follow the steps described below:

# On Jira, click the magnifier icon at the left of the screen and click *View all filters*
# Locate the filter affected by the problem and click *more(...) > Edit filter details*
# Click the trash can icon next to *Project: [Unknown Project]*
# Click *Save*
fields.summary: Filters cannot be edited or have their owner changed if it is shared with a project which cannot be accessed

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

User is unable to add their JIRA dashboards in an IFrame on an external website due to X-Frame being set to Same Origin 

h3. Suggested Solution

Site-admins to have the ability to modify the X-Frame settings.

It would be nice to have an option to disable the X-Frame setting and also an option to whitelist domains using *X-Frame-Options: ALLOW-FROM* which will make the instance more secure than completely disabling it.

h3. Why this is important

Some users are missing features like adding their JIRA dashboard to their own website because of this X-Frame setting. Some users might want to take the increased risk of their instance being used for ClickJacking as long as they can use their instance in an IFrame.
 
h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: Allow X-Frame options to be altered on JIRA CLOUD

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Since the new UI when viewing an issue and you use the shortcut key (.) to edit the Summary or any other field, the field is highlighted but not focused to type in. You must click in the field first before typing. This was not the case on the previous UI and it defeats the purpose of using keyboard shortcuts.
h3. Environment
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Steps to reproduce (keyboard only):
1) Navigate to any issue
2) Press .
3) Start typing summary
4) Select Summary from overlay window
5) Summary field is highlighted, but not focused for typing
h3. Expected Results

The Summary field should be focused for typing without using the mouse. 
h3. Actual Results

The field is highlighted but not focused for keyboard entry
h3. Notes
h3. Workaround

No existing workarounds. Fields can still be edited once clicked.
fields.summary: Keyboard shortcut to edit issue fields does not focus on field after new interface

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you create an issue collector selecting "Attempt to match user session of submitter or submitter email address", the issue creation can show inconsistent results, not taking into account Application Access, only project permission. More details on the steps to reproduce.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create an Issue Collector with a default reporter. 
# Set it up to "Attempt to match user session of submitter or submitter email address".
# Create an HTML file and include the issue collector script.

* *Scenario 1*:

# Create user with no application access and no permissions set under the People tab of the project.
# Try to submit a ticket using the issue collector and informing the email address of the user you've just created. 
*Result:* the issue is created and the reporter is set to the registered user.

* *Scenario 2*:

# Create a user with no application access and add the user to a Project role under the People tab of the project. 
# Grant a permission to the Project role in the permission scheme associated with the project.
# Try to submit a ticket using the issue collector and informing the email address of the user you've just created. 
*Result:* the issue is not created and the user receives the following error message:

{panel}*Oops! Something went wrong...*

There was a problem submitting your feedback, likely due to the configuration of this form. You might want to contact the site owner to let them know about this issue."{panel}

h3.Workaround

To workaround the error message shown in the *Scenario 2*, we can remove the user from the Project role under the People tab.
fields.summary: Inconsistency in issue collectors when attempting to match user session of submitter or submitter email address

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When restricting the comments using the *Comment visibility* feature available in JIRA General Settings, a webhook will send the following information in the JSON payload: 

{code}
 "created": "2018-03-13T14:13:40.307-0300",
        "updated": "2018-03-13T14:13:40.307-0300",
        "visibility": {
            "type": "group",
            "value": "administrators"
{code}

However, this only applies to JIRA Core and JIRA Software. When using *JIRA Service Desk*,  the *Comment Internally* button is used instead in order to make a comment restricted. When inspecting the webhook payload that is sent by JIRA when this button is used, there's no data specifying whether a comment is internal or not.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a JIRA Service Desk project
# Setup a webhook using the following events: 
** *Comment*: created updated deleted  
# Leave an internal comment using the *Comment Internally* button
# Verify the payload that will be sent by JIRA

h3. Expected Results
There should be a clear indication informing if the comment was set as internal or not in the JSON payload.

h3. Actual Results
The information is not available so there's no way to distinguish both.
fields.summary: I'd like to have some data specifying whether a comment is internal or not in the webhook payload that is sent when a comment is made in JSD
Fix documentation

h3. Summary

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add any add-on to the instance;
# Create a backup.

h3. Expected Results
* The data of every add-on is also included on the backup.

h3. Actual Results
* ?
* It will depend on the add-on.

h3. Workaround(s)
* Contact the support services of every add-on installed on your instance to verify how the add-on deals with data.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When copying the description field to a custom field using a post function, the error We can't create this issue for you right now, it could be due to unsupported content you've entered into one or more of the issue fields. If this situation persists, contact your administrator as they'll be able to access more specific information in the log file. Is shown in the UI.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field with multi line text
 # Create a post function in a workflow to copy from the Description field to the custom field
 # Execute workflow

h3. Expected Results

Description field content is copied to the custom field.
h3. Actual Results

The error We can't create this issue for you right now, it could be due to unsupported content you've entered into one or more of the issue fields. If this situation persists, contact your administrator as they'll be able to access more specific information in the log file. Is shown in the UI.

Log files show:
{code:java}
Unable to copy value from field 'Description' to 'Custom Field Name'.	

{code}
h3. Note

This same behaviour also occurs with *Select list* custom fields and possibly other fields types.
{code:java}
logger:	 com.atlassian.jira.workflow.function.issue.CopyValueFromOtherFieldPostFunction
{code}
h3. Workaround

None at this time.
fields.summary: Cannot copy description field to a custom field when using a post function.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Statuses or resolutions with composite names (to do, in progress) do not trigger the smart query feature.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a status/resolution with a composite name.
# Try to search for this term in the quick search

h3. Expected Results
The smart query is properly triggered:
!smart-query-status.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The smart query is not triggered. Instead, the search is done using the *text ~* term:
!quick-search-text.png|thumbnail!

None

fields.description:
*Summary*

If you have a large number of custom fields which is included in the screen of the issue for Edit/View configuration, when clicking on Edit > Configure Fields > the list populate goes out of bounds and you are not able to click on the fields which are populate beyond that. This affects both columns Show Fields: All | Custom and you will not be able to scroll down further. 

*Environment*

New Jira Look and Feel 

 

*Steps to Reproduce*
 # Make sure the custom field has about more than 30 fields configured in the Custom Field page.
 # Link all those 30 custom fields to a screen for Edit/View configuration, so that it will be generated in the issue view details page. 
 # Create an issue which is linked to the screen configuration > Click on Edit > Configure Fields > click on either Show Fields: All or Show Fields: Custom, you will get the following results: 

 

  *Show Fields: All* Out of Bounds, Unable to Scroll Further
!outofbounds2.png|width=737,height=441!

*Show Fields: Custom* Out of Bounds, Unable to Scroll Further
!image-2018-03-12-23-54-23-613.png|width=648,height=388!



In this scenario, the second Approver field is stuck half-way and the fields below the second Approver field do not show as well even though they are configured in the field configuration. 

 

*Expected Results*

The "Configure Fields" options for Show Field: All | Custom shows the entire list and you are able to scroll all the way to view all the options. 

 

*Actual Results*

The "Configure Fields" options for Show Field: All | Custom is cut off and you are unable to scroll and view the full list or configure the Custom options.
fields.summary: Configure Fields: Results Goes Out of Bounds With Large Number of Custom Fields

fields.description:
There are two articles, one for Server and the other for Cloud, that explains the *smart query* feature.
On both articles there is a list of terms that can be used to trigger the smart query.

Searching for an existing status will also trigger the smart query, but this information is not covered in the article:
 !smart-query-status.png|thumbnail! 

Here's the documentation:

*Cloud* - https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/get-home-search-or-create-with-the-global-sidebar-937886032.html

*Server* - https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver073/quick-searching-861257204.html#UsingQuickSearch-Smartquerying

It would be necessary to add in the list something like:
{{<status>}} - Find issues with a particular Status - {{To Do, Backlog, Open}}
fields.summary: Search for statuses are not specified in the smart query feature

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 Every time the user switches between the projects it lands up to the last accessed page but if the user's last accessed page is issue navigator, the user is not directed back to the issue navigator page.
h3.  Steps to Reproduce

1. Select any project and navigate to either Components/Release/Page section of that project.
2. Select Issues link of that project and select all issues query/filter and then come out of that project.
3. When you again select that same project, it will redirect to the last accessed link that could be Components/Release/Page. However, it should redirect to the issues window.
h3. Expected Results

If the last accessed page is the issue navigator, it should land onto the issue navigator page.
h3. Actual Results

It lands on the last accessed page that is either Components/Release/Page but not onto the issue navigator page.
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Last accessed page is not the issue navigator

fields.description:
{panel:title=Status Update - 13 March 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}
The Agile board links are now available again in the project sidebar for the old Jira interface. Please contact Atlassian Support if any issue persists. 

--------------------------------------------


h3. Summary
On some Jira instances, although the Location of the board is within a Project, the board cannot be seen at the left sidebar, as if they are not connected. Besides that, it is also not possible to view the Kanban, Backlog and Active Sprints, as these buttons are also missing on the sidebar.

h3. Environment
- Atlassian Cloud
- Old Jira Interface

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Switch to the Old Jira Interface
# Go to a board which is located under a project

h3. Expected Results
The Kanban, Backlog, Active sprints and Board Report links should appear at the sidebar.
 !working.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The board links are missing from the sidebar menu. 

h3. Workaround
- Switch to the New Jira Experience by clicking on the Profile Icon at the top right, and select "Experience the new Jira"
!board-oldUI.png|thumbnail!  !board-newUI.png|thumbnail!  
In the new JIRA experience, the board links will be available on the project configured as the Board Location in the board settings (Three Dot Menu > Board Settings).
 !board location.png|thumbnail! 

- Alternatively, you can use shortcut keys '1' and '2' to switch between the Board and the Backlog without switching to the new interface.
fields.summary: Board links are missing from the sidebar

In some old articles, there is no way to identify if the article can be used in recent versions of Jira/Confluence. This can be more confusing for Cloud users who may not be familiar with the documentation.

For instance: https://confluence.atlassian.com/agile063/jira-agile-user-s-guide/planning-a-version/creating-a-version
These instructions are meant to be used in Jira Agile 6.3, however, unless you are familiar with the end of life policy, users can be confused and try to use the instructions of these articles.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a user attempts to upload an attachment to an issue with a copied image in the clipboard, the user clicks on the "Drop files to attach, or browse" link, and presses CTRL+V. However, Jira does not handle this behavior correctly.

h3. Environment
 - Atlassian Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to an issue. (<instance-name>.atlassian.net/browse/<issue-key>)
# Copy an image, from a snipping tool, or simply by clicking on PrintScreen button (on the keyboard).
# Click on the "Drop files t o attach, or browse" under the Attachments section.
# Press CTRL+V

h3. Expected Results
The image will be uploaded to the ticket through the "Upload Attachment Window" (which says "Drag and drop your files anywhere or *Upload a file*), _or_, close the current window, and redirect the user to the "Attach Screenshot" window.

h3. Actual Results
The "Main window" stays in focus, however, at the back, we can see that the "Attach Screenshot" window appears. The user would then need to click "Cancel" on the front-most window, and select the "Upload" button on the "Attach Screenshot" window.
 !paste-image.png|thumbnail! 

In this screenshot, notice the "Attach Screenshot" window at the back.

h3. Workaround
- Click on "Cancel" on the front-most window, and select the "Upload" button on the "Attach Screenshot" window.
- Or, paste the image (CTRL+V) *without* clicking on the "Drop files to attach, or browse" link.
fields.summary: When pasting a screenshot, the "Attach Screenshot" window appears behind the main window

h3. Summary
When a user navigates to the *activity* or *people activity* sections of the new Atlassian Home for the instance, the activity logs do not show absolute time for activities (not even on mouse hover)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- For People Activities:
-# Go to https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/home/people
-# Select a user that is displayed
-# Click on the *Activity* tab

- For instance Activities:
-# Go to https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/home/activity
-# Select the *All* tab (in case the *Watching* one is not returning any result)

 
h3. Expected Results
Activities are using absolute time (e.g 12/07/2018 - 16:33)

h3. Actual Results 
Activities are shown using relative time instead (e.g 8 days ago)

h3. Notes
Mousing over time stamp does not display absolute time

h3. Workaround
Open a Support Request in [support.atlassian.com|https://support.atlassian.com|https://support.atlassian.com/] and ask to be rolled back to the old UI
fields.summary: People and instance activities in Atlassian Home are shown using relative time instead of absolute time

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Not able to configure different default fields for various project in a custom field (Select List (single choice)).

Say there is a custom field called "Levels" with option 1,2,3,4. Say Project A needs to have a default option 1, Project B needs default option 2, Project C needs default option 3.
h3. Suggested Solution

Option to configure the default option for each project in one _Context_ in Custom field configuration without creating a new context for each Project and repeating the options.

h3. Workaround

Add a new context for each Project and configure the options and set the default value.

This workaround is tiresome when there are a lot of projects that have the custom field which needs a different default value. Say if 10 Projects are having the custom field and each of them should have different values, we might need to configure 10 contexts and repeatedly configure the same options to set a default value.
fields.summary: Set different default values across different projects for the custom field (Select List (single choice))

*Summary*

With the New Jira Issue View in a Business Project (Board and Full Page), the Tempo Time Tracking option is not available. If the Time logging option is switched back to "Jira Provided Time Tracking", the time tracking option appears in the issue view. 

 

*Steps to Reproduce*

  1. Install the Tempo add-on in your instance. Use the default "Jira Provided Time Tracker" at first. 
   2. Create a basic Business Project and create an issue.
   3. From the issue's three dot menu, you will have the option to "Log Time" 
   4. Go to the "Time Logging" page > switch the "Jira Provided Time Tracker" to "Tempo Timesheet" 
   5. View the issue again and the three dot menu will have no option to log time via the Tempo add-on. 

 

*Expected Results*
Logging of time using Tempo should be available on the view.

 !Tempo option.png|thumbnail! 



*Actual Results*
 There is no option to log time in the new Jira issue view.

 !no option.png|thumbnail! 


*Note:*

This  also affects the Tempo "Accounts" field.
This does not appear to be an issue in the Jira Software Project for both Kanban and Scrum Boards, the right side menu pop-up contains both Jira Time Tracker Provided or Tempo one.
* !tempo_empty.png|width=744,height=354! *
fields.summary: Tempo TimeSheet Option Does Not Appear in the New JIRA Issue view For Business Projects

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Based on [Atlassian Cloud IP ranges and domains|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/atlassian-cloud-ip-ranges-and-domains-744721662.html] documentations, admin need to whitelist a big number of IP. Some company will have a concern about allowing a big amount of IP going into their firewall.
h3. Suggested Solution

It will be great if Atlassian Cloud have the ability to narrow down the IP based on location.
h3. Why this is important

From a business standpoint, there are multitudes of company with different firewall and IP range settings to which it would be best if Atlassian is able to cater to this use cases that helps the customer to maintain their position in the Cloud environment. 
h3. Workaround

The workaround is not effective within the Cloud environment  as it requires the customer to pursue a server solution instead. Nonetheless, if it's critical to the business, adapting the Atlassian server option is the only feasible path right now.
fields.summary: Reduce the IP address range to be whitelisted based on customer location

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently the JIRA import tool will fail if there are any groups in the backup file that contain a trailing white space.

h3. Suggested Solution

Check for any groups with trailing white space and allow users to edit them before the import proceeds

h3. Why this is important

The current workaround for this issue requires this to be fixed on the source instance by deleting the group, recreating it without the trailing white space, add all members back to the new group, and update all permission schems and other settings to use the new group or modifying the entities.xml file manually removing the trailing white space from all occurrences in the file.
fields.summary: Check for trailing white space in group names before import

fields.description:
*Summary*
After adding a Confluence Space in a JIRA project using the tab 'Pages', the pages in that Space do not appear.

*Environment*

Steps to Reproduce
# go to Confluence and restrict the "Overview" page (which is the home page of the Space)
# create a Space and add some pages to it
# go to a JIRA project, click on 'Pages' tab and link the Space created

*Expected Results*
The pages in the Space will appear.

*Actual Results*
No pages show up.

*Workaround*
# create a dummy page with all the same restrictions as "Overview" and put this new page below "Overview"
# reorder the pages putting them below this new dummy
# remove the restrictions on "Overview".
# go to a JIRA project, click on 'Pages' tab and link any Space
fields.summary: After adding a Confluence Space in a JIRA project using the tab 'Pages', the pages in that Space do not appear.

fields.description:
{panel:title=Product Update - Dec 20th, 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#add8e6|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone, I am happy to share with you that we have rolled out the ability to configure the field layout on the new issue view! This is available to all customers who have the new issue view enabled. You can find more information here: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/configure-field-layout-in-the-issue-view-961798059.html] 

Here are a couple of key points about this you should know. More detailed info is in the docs link above.
 * This only applies to classic projects that are using the new issue view. Next-gen project types already have the ability to add/remove/edit the field ordering of the issue view. See [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/working-with-next-gen-software-projects-945104895.html] 
 * The new Issue Layout option in your project settings is what allows you to order your fields. It still gets the list of available fields from your global screen config that is being applied to the specific issue type you are editing within that project. If you change the ordering this will *only* affect the field layout for those issue types within that specific project. The new Issue Layout option is *not* a global setting. It is a per project setting.
 * Only project admins and site admins have access to this Issue Layout option. It can be accessed by clicking on the ... within any issue detail view. Or go to your project settings.

If you have any questions, or would like to see some improvements, there is a feedback collector on the Issue Layout edit page. So give us your feedback, we are looking to iterate and improve this moving forward but we are excited about this change. We hope it makes using the new issue view much more enjoyable!

Taylor Pechacek, Jira Cloud - Sr. PM

 
{panel}


 
h2. Reported Issue

Currently, the fields visible in the [new Jira issue view|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/the-new-jira-issue-view-938040503.html], more specifically in the context panel cannot be reordered:
 !new-issue-view.png|thumbnail!

It would be useful to have an option to reorder/rearrange these fields so it won't be necessary to scroll down to get the information of the field you are looking for. Depending on how much information is contained in the issue, having this information cluttered in the context panel does not help the visibility.

This is important because in certain cases, there are too many fields in the issue, and have this information available right away would be useful.
fields.summary: Provide the ability to reorder the context fields in the new Jira issue view

fields.description: As a Jira Mobile User, I would like to sort the issues list with the same functionalities as the Jira desktop.
fields.summary: As a Jira Mobile User, I would like to sort issues

fields.description:
h3.Summary

Some email clients like Outlook 2016 is showing raw HTML contents of JIRA notifications. In some cases, the preview also have its white spaces strip causing the preheader to look compressed. Instead of "User X have commented ..." it becomes "UserXhavecommented...". In other cases, HTML links also shows as plain text.

!ugly.png|thumbnail!

Although each email client handles email preview/preheaders differently, it will be good if JIRA notifications preheaders are coded to be able to handle Outlook clients.

Here are a few samples that might help :

* [preheaders shows code instead of text|https://litmus.com/community/discussions/162-preheader-shows-code-instead-of-text]
* [spaces removed from text in inbox preview|https://litmus.com/community/discussions/5323-spaces-removed-from-text-in-inbox-preview]
fields.summary: JIRA notification preheader doesn't show correctly on Outlook email preview

fields.description:
h2. Summary

When adding a screen to a transition, the option to click Browse when uploading an attachment no longer displays. The option to Browse shows up in all other cases (Edit Issue, View Issue, etc)
h2. Steps to Reproduce

Create a screen
 Add the screen to a workflow transition such as Done
 Click Done on an issue and click on Attachment icon. The Browse option does not show
 Expected Results
 Clicking on the Attachment icon displays the option to Browse
h2. Actual Results

The Browse option does not show
h2. Workaround

Use Edit Issue or View Issue screen for browse feature

Add the attachments field to the screen used by the transition workflow. There will be an attachments dropzone area to allow adding attachments in the transition screen
fields.summary: Adding A Screen In A Workflow Transition Results In Loss of the Attachment Button

fields.description:
h3. Summary

* For a custom field of type Select List (single choice) that has two (2) values A and B. 
* After adding the context and specifying the default value as "A" we are expecting it to be populated to the next created issues and also for editing the existent issues. 
* But, currently it afect the new issues but break the default value for editing the existent issues.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Create a custom field drop down called Spaceteam
2. Populate with options A, B
3. Add the custom field to the create and resolve Screens
4. Create an issue in project "Gokoko" and select option B for the custom field
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
5. Go back to the custom field Spaceteam and add a context
6. Duplicate the list of options from the parent custom field into the new context
7. Set the default to the context as option A
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
8. Set the assigned project Gokoko for this context
9. Go back to the issue created in step 4 and click on the Edit Issue button
10. Observe the custom field
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 
11. Back out of the edit screen
12. Resolve the issue so the resolve issue screen pops up
13. Observe the custom field
 !screenshot-4.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
* Custom field is populated with option B set in step 4 

h3. Actual Results
* Custom field is unpopulated 
* value "None" is shown by default
fields.summary: Configure context for Select List (single choice) custom field break default value for old issues

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If you create a post function (Update issue custom field), and check the *Append value* in the Custom field value, it won't let you perform that transition, throwing an error:
 !Screen Shot 2018-03-06 at 5.09.53 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 1. Create a User picker (multi value) custom field;
 2. Configure a *Update issue custom field* post function in a workflow transition;
 3. During the post function configuration, check *Append value*, then click on Add:
 !Screen Shot 2018-03-06 at 5.13.42 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 4. Publish the workflow;
 5. Try to perform the transition where the post function was configured.


h3. Expected Results
The transition will happen and set a value to the field.

h3. Actual Results
It won't be possible to perform the transition. Displaying an error: Illegal workflow operation.

h3. Workaround

No workaround at the moment
fields.summary: Transition will fail if append value is checked in the update custom field in a post function

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The *Pages* integration mentioned in [this article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/integrating-with-collaboration-tools-776830282.html] does not find Confluence pages from another instance, even with the project links properly set. Currently, the functionality works if Jira and Confluence are in the same instance.

h3. Suggested Solution
Expand the functionality so it can be used to integrate with Confluence from a different instance.

h3. Why this is important
As it's possible to create an application link to a different instance and create links, it would be a good addition to have this functionality working, since some customer have more than one instance.
 
h3. Workaround 
None.
fields.summary: Improve the Pages functionality to integrate with Confluence from another instance

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Sprint modal is no responsive with the screen dimensions when it is lower than 1366X768. 
When there are some alert messages when starting a sprint, the 'start sprint window' height does not adapt to fit the screen dimensions and due to that, the user can't reach either the *Start Sprint* or *Cancel* button. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Set a height limit or change the way these modals select size, or scroll behavior - either the modal needs to adjust the size for the viewport or the modal needs to be tied to the top of the page rather than the center so that it scrolls with the browser scrollbar.

h3. Workaround
Use a 75% zoom.
fields.summary: Jira windows should better adapt themselves when displayed on lower screen resolutions.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If the user profile's time zone is (GMT+00:00) Lisbon and the filter (which uses startOfDay(), returning issues that were created during that same day) is configured to be triggered, for example, at 9 pm (GMT-05:00) New York, the user will receive an email with no results.

It looks like instead of using the instance's default time zone, Jira will attempt to get results based in the profile's time zone.

*I've tried to reproduce with another time zone:* my test instance's default time zone is 	(GMT-03:00) Sao Paulo, and I set a user's profile time zone to (GMT+12:00) Fiji, and even though the time when the filter triggered was already the next day to Fiji's time zone, the results were correct.
 
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Perform an advanced search like *project in (PROJECT) AND created >= startOfDay() created DESC* and save it as a filter;
# Create a subscription with the previous filter, setting it to trigger at (GMT-05:00) New York;
# Change one of the user's (subscribed) profile's time zone to (GMT+00:00) Lisbon.

h3. Expected Results
Jira should send results based on the instance's default time zone, like it happens with another time zones set in the profile.
h3. Actual Results
No results will be sent even though there were issues created during the day.

h3. Workaround
Have the users use the instance's default time zone, or change the time when the filter will be triggered so it the users with Lisbon's time zone don't get notified in the next day (according to the time zone).
fields.summary: Issue filter subscription sends inconsistent result to users with (GMT+00:00) Lisbon time zone

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The description field has a character limit of 32,767 but this is not mentioned in the issue view.

h3. Suggested solution

Adding this information somewhere in the field before actually reaching that limit to avoid wasted time and unpleasant surprises.
fields.summary: Description field character limit not mentioned

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the New Jira Issue View, it is very difficult to type in decimal numbers for Number Fields.

h3. Environment
- Atlassian Cloud
- New Jira Issue View

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Ensure that you are using the New Jira Issue View.
# Create a Custom Field with the type "Number Field"
# Include this field in the View Issue & Edit Issue screens.
# Go to an issue in the board, and attempt to edit the Number Field.


h3. Expected Results
# When attempting to type "0.5",
#- Type in zero, followed by dot, followed by five.
# When attempting to type "0.005",
#- Type in zero, followed by dot, zero, zero, five.

h3. Actual Results
# When attempting to type "0.5",
#- Typing 0 will not input anything.
#- Need to type Dot, followed by 5.
# When attempting to type "0.005",
#- Need to type Dot, followed by 5. Then, move cursor back and add the other two zeroes.

h3. Workaround
# Edit the issue outside of the Board, ie, directly on the issue page.
# Switch off the New Jira Issue View by going to your user profile, under the "Labs" section.
fields.summary: Number Field in the New Jira Issue View handles decimal numbers poorly

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, to be able to unfurl Jira issues in channels in Slack, you have to connect each Jira project to each channel, independently of how many channels and projects you have. After it, you can unfurl the issues. 

As a user, I would like an easy way to connect Jira projects to Slack channels.

h3. Suggested Solution

Make it possible to:

# Install integration
# Tell bot which channels to reside in
# Create a filter for which issues the bot should unfurl ("project in (TEST, TEST2)", for example, if you only cared about those) or allow bot to unfurl ALL issues in the JIRA installation.
# Done!
fields.summary: Slack integration: Easy way to connect Jira projects to Slack channels

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The *Projects* section of an instance lists all the projects which can be accessed and this list has some information, like the project name, key, type, owner, category, and URL. However, none of this information is helpful to identify the type of the project:
 !project-list.png|thumbnail! 

In the above-mentioned screenshot, there are some projects where the name purposefully describes the project type. But currently, there's no way to identify if the created project is a Scrum, Kanban or independent(Agility) accessing the project list. All of them are categorized as 'Software' type.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a reliable way to identify the type of the project in the UI, so it won't be necessary to access the project directly to confirm its type.

h3. Why this is important
With the addition of independent projects, it would be useful to know the type of the existing projects, to make sure you aren't trying to do something on a project where certain functionalities are not available.
 
h3. Workaround 
None.
fields.summary: Provide a way to identify the project type in the UI

fields.description:
As described in the two documents below, the *External System Import* functionality is different then the *Create issues from CSV*. 
 * [Creating issues using the CSV importer|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/creating-issues-using-the-csv-importer-764478441.html]
 * [Importing data from CSV|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/importing-data-from-csv-776636762.html]

However, the statements below lead to believe that it is possible to map both the *reporter* and the *assignee* when performing a *Bulk Create from CSV* operation:
{quote}
If you are importing a username-based CSV field (e.g. Reporter or Assignee) and you do not check the Map field value option for this field, then the import process will automatically map imported usernames from the CSV file to (lowercase) Jira usernames.

You can choose to have the importer automatically create Jira users for any values of the Assignee or Reporter field.
{quote}

The problem is, whenever trying to map the Assignee field, it is not returned in the existing Jira fields:
 *  !Screen Shot 2018-03-05 at 11.51.26 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to reproduce:
 # Click *Issues > Search issues*
 # Click the *...* button and select *Import issues from CSV*
 # Upload the CSV file and try to map the Assignee field
fields.summary: Impossible to map assignee on CSV import
